data.text: @GutweinTeam Called a plumber yesterday, he can’t work for a week because his kid got COVID in school. No income for him because ‘schools are the best place for kids’… to get sick and potentially life-long illnesses.
@peterhickstas @solskjaer025 @aeutasmania @GutweinTeam Happy to drop a relief coordinator mobile phone off at 15 Murray in the morning… A tweet devoid of any reality…
@GutweinTeam I had to check to see if this was a parody account
@solskjaer025 @aeutasmania @GutweinTeam Relief coordinators are exhausted. So many staff away either with the virus or close contacts.

@GutweinTeam Positive start? As in staff and students testing positive for COVID? I would love for the Premier or Minister to have a chat to the relief co-ordinators at schools where staff are absent and ask them how positive the start of the year has been! #politas
@GutweinTeam Interesting to see who likes pure-spin tweets like this. 🤔🤨

@GutweinTeam A positive start to the year does not usually involve schools madly searching out relief staff and dozens of classes having relief teachers for a week or more. Please don't gaslight the community. It has been a tough start to the year, and you should acknowledge that.
